author: PaulC
title: Atlantis looks promising!
review:
The new Atlantis range has some of the coolest looking subs Lego have ever produced. Although some would prefer the more contemporary yellow underwater vehicles of themes past, these bright red Anime-inspired futuristic submersibles have a very strong unified design that gives them a real wow-factor, so I'm expecting this line to sell well.

Sometimes stickers add a lot to the look of a set, but because the design is so good these sets just don't need them. Leaving the stickers off means the pieces can be reused in many more ways, but in this case there is not a great number of parts for your £8 GBP so not many alternative models can be made, which is rather a shame.

I expect most kids will just assemble the sub as is, and then take it on adventures. The flick-fire missiles work ok as there is plenty of room to flick your finger at them, although their range is compromised a little by the heavy ends. Also the grappling hooks don't fit too snugly so there is a high probability of losing them if the missiles are used much.

The Shark-men I think are the coolest looking of the Atlantean adversaries. The "collectable" golden ring matches his trident so I am using it a his shield for now. The head and trident are rubberised, so will put up with much abuse and also be easier on parent's feet when they "find" them in the night.

Overall a neat little set with a clever 3-wide design. I've taken a point off for the inability to build many alternative models and the loose grappling hooks!

author: Krataka15792
title: Watch out for the Shark...man...thing!
review:
This is one of the sets I got using my Christmas Money and I have to say, It isn't that bad! The box catches the eye of the consumer, as the brave Diver fights for his life against the shark warrior in order to obtain the key to atlantis.

Minifigures:
There are only two minifigs in this set: the Diver, and the shark warrior. I will start off with the shark warrior. The Shark warrior is a pretty good minifig it has no head underneath the "Shark-head" piece for the shark head piece is the only piece for the head. Unlike a psat harry potter set which had two heads, a shark and the man underneath. The head has some sort of a Tattoo on the top of the head and has the clearly accepted mold of an accurate shark. You can stick a rod in its mouth from the side (Try the nice rubber trident). It's trident is rubber which is surprising, but satisfying.

The diver is pretty good and the torso is double printed. I understand that the diver is a charcter in the new Atlantis movie coming to tv in january. The Diver's helmet is a new piece and fits the fig pretty well. it also come with these attachable flippers for the diver.

The next paragraph isn't about a minifig but about the treasure piece that the set comes with. It is an octopus, with some strange symbols urrounding it. It is translucent and it has a connector piece on the bottom

Build:
Not much to say about the build accept it was fast. It took me 5 minutes to build it.

Design:

The design is pretty slick, and I think there is a new piece in the build. The flick fire harpoons are a pretty cool addition to the set (I actually don't mind flick fire missiles at all). The harpoons are a little loose but they don't fall out, which is a relief. The diver can hold on to the back of the Wreck Raider and steer it to battle wth the Shark Warrior!

Pros:
Great Minifigs
New Pieces Collectable Treasure piece
Harpoon missiles
Quick and Easy build
Impressive design

Cons:
Loose Harpoons
stickers
Flippers easily come off

The Pros heavily out weigh te cons b a long shot, and I highly reccomend this set. it is a great set and one of my favorites. again, I highly reccomend it to everyone, especially for the collactable treasure key to atlantis! Next Review: Guardian of the Deep!

author: legoguy2805
title: Wreck Raider
review:
This was my second Atlantis set, and it is awesome. The Wreck Raider is very bulky and has flick-fire harpoons, and the set comes with two minifigures, Ace Speedman and a Shark Warrior, who has a trident. And obviously it comes with the blue, second treasure key, which comes in its own tiny bag, like the individual Rock Monsters from the Power Miners range.

Pros:
Ace Speedman
Shark Warrior
Blue treasure key
Flick-fire harpoons
Stands up well
Value for money

Cons:
Loads of Stickers... again...

But overall, this set is billiant, 5/5.

author: michaelvader
title: THE LAST KEY WE (I) NEED!
review:
This set gave me my 5th Atlantis key and yes they are each different. So now I am waiting for the Portal Of Atlantis to put all the keys there. The diver is the commander in the show, so its nice to have him. Now I have 2 sharks. The key has the squid on it.I like these flick-fire spears. Oh and the set looks bigger then on the box. And it has 8 STICKERS! that sucks.

5/5 or a 10/10

author: galonschiente
title: Attack of the great white!
review:
Okay, im going to seperate this into parts so here we go-

Minifigures-

Diver- This minifig is very nice and is a good addition to any collection, especially pirates, as this minifig looks a lot like brickbeard. Also the detailing on the torso and legs is just brilliant! He has the standard diver breathing equipment which allows him to swim in deep waters. The flippers are also cool. LEGO, you've done a great job on this minifig! A couple more things, if you buy more than one of this set you can make a pirate army! The mask is customizable with technic pieces!
5/5 for this minifig!

Shark warrior- Once again, this minifig is a great addition to any collection, and because this set is priced at just £7.00 you can buy a few at once (if you have enough money) and build an army! There are strange Atlantian markings on his head which is made of rubber. You can slightly see the top of the minifig neck from his mouth, but you can hardly call that a con. On the torso and legs are more strange markings which shows that he might have been mutated into half-human by something. This is my first shark minifig, and because this set is cheap, that that makes it even better! Of course the shark also has gills and a dorsal fin.
5/5 for this minifig!

Accessories-

Trident- This golden trident is, although very common, very cool. You can paint it red and make a custom Satan with it!
5/5 for this accessory!

Blue Atlantian key- This thing was a pain to get out of the bag, but that's not going to deduct from the score. The stud on the bottom is sweet. Obviously a minifig can hold it. Also, it has a squid/octopus symbol on it.
5/5 for this accessory!

Weck Raider- The Wreck Raider is nice and easy to build. There are some stickers which slow down the build a little but they are simple to apply. There are two propellers situated on either side at the back. If you blow on them they will spin. There are even two flick fire missiles with a nice little hook in the middle of each of them. I find them to work better if you put them in the second slot. There are also two fins on each side that can move up and down. 
5/5 for the Wreck Raider!

Altogether, this set gets a 25/25, a 100% review!

review:

author: chrisdog121411
title: Nice atlantis set
review:
This is a nice Atlantis set but there are some cons.

Pros

  • 67 Parts

  •  

Cons

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: A neat little set, even if a little unsightly
review:
First of all, I will explain my title. I think this set is excellent, although it is not the best looking set Lego has ever made.

Shark Man, Trident + 'Key':

The shark head piece is excellent. It looks like a real shark's head, even including the gills. There is a pattern in dark blue on the top of its head, with a picture of an Atlantis 'key' in the centre. The shark's mouth can hold any lego object with a (lightsaber blade) stick part in its mouth.The shark's trident is well sculpted and resembles a real trident. The 'key' is a neat looking triangle within a ring. On the hidden side of the triangle, there is a hole that allows connection to basic lego pieces. The only problem with the key is that it shows a picture of a squid, while it should be a shark.

Atlantis Diver:

The Atlantis diver has a new helmet + airtanks piece. It looks very fitting with the theme, although slightly restricts movement. The Visor is larger than standard, but makes an excellent effect on the helmet. There are two holes in the sides of the helmet that allow technic pins to fit. The airtanks are hollow, and the bottom holes allow standard lego pieces to connect. The only piece missing would be a harpoon gun.

The Wreck Raider:

The Wreck raider has a very large front piece. This part is very sturdy and helps to hold the harpoon guns in place. The centrepiece is an engine. This helps as a mounting point for main pieces. It also holds the set together well. On the back of the main engine, there are two lego-technic 1*1*2 pieces, that hold the directional engines in place. The directional engines swivel, but hold their place. The two propellers are excellent pieces, and are extremely fitting with the set.

Pros:

  • Good pieces
  • 'Key'
  • Shark man
  • Diver suit
  • Propellers
  • Trident

Cons:

  • Seems too fat at the front
  • Diver must hang on for his life
  • Seems unbalanced

Overall: An excellent set to start with, as if you don't like the theme too much, you will not have wasted much money. This set is also excellent for rarer parts, like the propellers, harpoons and engine. An excellent set.

author: Brickman193
title: Deep Sea Danger, AKA Wreck Raider (Atlantis 8057)
review:
Many would consider the humble Wreck Raider to be the little brother of the Typhoon Turbo Sub (8060) or the Neptune Carrier (8075). However, the Wreck Raider is a nice set on its own or as an introduction, or perhaps as a support for the aforementioned bigger subs.

  • MINIFIGS: The set includes two minifigs; one deep sea diver and an Atlantis fish-man. The deep sea diver appears to be the veteran of the team, as he has a grey beard and only one eye. With him you get the new diving suit in green and grey and one of the six Atlantis keys. The shark man, or Atlantis warrior, is superbly detailed with a sturdy new headpiece. On said head (heheh, rhymes) the Sharkman features tattoos that have an Atlantis key in the centre. To fight the humans, the fish man carries a new pearl gold trident. 5/5
  • WRECK RAIDER: The smallest vehicle beyond the Sea Jet, the Wreck Raider functions presumably as a scout vehicle, or escort. To these ends, it features flick fire hooks that have a 360 degree field to fire in. To propel the vehicle, two propellors that can change direction for reversing, hovering, lowering and so on. There are minor decals - they can be avoided without ruining the look of the set but they do look cool. 4/5

All in all, the Wreck Raider is a fine set, if a little small, that works best when accompanied with larger sets like the Turbo Sub or the Neptune Carrier. But if you want a set with desirable playability and "swooshability" then this a major contender. 9/10

author: Kalhiki
title: My First Atlantis Set
review:
Well, I've picked up my first Atlantis set. First of all, I was never a fan of undersea based themes, but Atlantis seemed cool to me. Therefore I decided to pick up a cheap set.

The building experience wasn't too much. Though I did think the turbines would be double hinged. Instead, one of the conectors in an axle, which leaves that part immobile. The stickers are also pretty nice and add that flare of detail. I also like how Lego is incorporating the set number into the actual model. This one, on the side, has 8-057.

I'll now describe the minifigs. How about... Ace?... first (is that his name?). As with most newer 'figs he has great detail printed on both front and back of his body. His pants are also nice with a trident insignia. On the body there are some shiny bits which really pop out. The head is new and with most new heads they are double sided. And to be noted, he does have that cool eyepatch that everyone wants these days. The helmet is a new piece which has four pin connectors on it in case you want to customize it. The visor has no movement, which is good 'cause I wouldn't want any water in my helmet.

Sharkman has less detail, but what he has is still cool. He has blueish Atlantian markings on the front of him, but nothing on the back. The Shark head is also one solid piece with no minifig head. The head, like Space Police Frenzy, has a hole in the teeth where he can 'bite' objects a 'fig could normally hold. Also, there are more Atlantian markings on his nose.

Any cool or rare parts? Well, there are some nice grappling hooks and turbines. Also the set comes with the cool new Atlantis Treasure Key. This time it's the blue squid key. The minifig is meant to hold it on the trans-blue part of the ring, but the gold area is a little smaller around allowing the 'fig to hold it there as well.

Playability is good. There aren't many gimmicks to this (on the back of the box they called moving the turbines a function). The flick-fire harpoons are cool as they have grappling hooks on the tips. Sadly, the hooks are a loose fit so be careful not to lose them. But you can always have Sharkman attack the sub or the diver as some playability. As for poseability, the flick fire harpoons can go up and down, the tubines can be angled up and down along with the fins on the sides.

I would have wished this was a little less pricey. Maybe $5, but I guess ten isn't... that bad... Eh, whatever. Overall this set is good. If you want an Atlantis set, maybe not put this on the top of the list. If you want something relatively cheap, then sure, pick it up. But I guess I can only mildly recommend this.

author: vynsane
title: Testing the waters (punny!)
review:
Along with the LEGO Atlantis impulse set (#8072 Sea Jet) I bought this set because I was interested in checking out the Atlantis theme without spending too much money (which is the reason for the title of this review). This set is meant to be a larger introduction than 8072, with a more formidable vehicle and the addition of an 'enemy' minifigure.

Figures

  • Ace Speedman - Ace has the requisite Atlantis diving apparatus (torso, legs, helmet, neon-green visor, lime green flippers) and double-printed head (one grim and determined, the other side in panic mode). The eyepatch and gray beard signify this guy as someone who's been around the reef, so for him to panic, you know he's seen something truly horrifying.
  • Shark Warrior - One can presume this is the guy who sent Ace into panic mode. The detailing on the torso and legs sell the idea of sharp, raspy scales well and the new theme-specific head mold is great. 

Accessories

Ace is the pilot of the main craft, and as such has no other accessory, but the Shark Warrior gets his share of items:
  • Trident - the Shark Warriors' weapon of choice
  • Atlantis Key - This is apparently the treasure that Ace is after, and the Shark Warrior is guarding - CONFLICT!

Build 

This sub (which has an almost 'cave-racer' quality to it) is centered on a single dark blue/gray cylinder piece. There's nothing very innovative or clever about the build, but the over-all effect is pleasing. 

Parts

The cylinder is the biggest piece, but some of the coolest are the two red technic cylinders that act as shrouds for the turbofan-style propellers, and those propellers themselves. The harpoon-tipped flick-fire missiles are cool looking s well.

Conclusion

While the part count is a bit low for the price, there are quite a few large pieces so the amount of plastic kind of measures out. For an introductory set it does a good job of giving you more information than the Sea Jet, and creating a battle-in-a-box between the diver and Shark Man.

author: icepick
title: Sweet new theme
review:
I bought this to check out the Atlantis theme and to get one of those sweet shark men.  It didn't fail me, and I kind of want to get a bunch of them now.

Build: Fast and easy.  No curve balls.  Don't bother putting the stickers one.  : )

Parts: Only downside is the slightly low piece count.  the pieces you get are really great, though.  I love the propellers on the sub, and and absolutely love the minifigs in this one.  The diver's head is great, and that shark man is one of the coolest mini figs I've ever seen.

Playability: Swoosh the sub and duke it out with the shark man.  not much missing here.

Value: Like I said, maybe a little bit low on the pieces, but a solid $10 set that I would definitely buy again.

author: live2servehm
title: "We got a SHARK MAN here!"
review:
I got this set for my birhtday and i must say, it's one of my favorite $10 sets.

  • Pros:
  • Mini-figs Great underwater suit and Great head for the Shark Man
  • Trident
  • Not to many decals, but not to few
  • Looks Really cool when finished
  • lots of playability
  • Cons:
  • The hooks come out of the flick-fire missiles often
  • They should have something new for the flippers
A GREAT set defiantly worth 10 bucks.

author: dragon_teenager
title: Extremely solid purchase
review:
If you like Atlantis, it's hard to go wrong with this set. If you're not a huge fan, this set probably won't change your mind, but it still serves as a decent parts pack with some nice minifigs.

I got this set on a whim, and found myself pretty pleased with the model after I finished building it. The construction is solid, with no extraneous parts and some very nice curves that bring out the overall shape of the vehicle. It looks decent from all angles, and aesthetically it definitely represents the Atlantis theme's strong suits.

Some rather predictable issues, though, arise with the inclusion of stickers and flick-fire missiles. I'm not usually too hard on stickers, but the very small surfaces on which you're asked to place them make for difficult application and can get frustrating. Without the stickers, the vessel still looks decent but noticeably more bland. I just decided to bite the bullet and apply them - you might prefer to leave them off, and I wouldn't blame you.

The flick fire missiles return for the millionth time, in all their barely-functional glory. These ones are slightly more annoying than usual, because the grappling hooks attached to the front of the projectiles often pop out. On the whole, though, the missiles don't really detract from the look of the vehicle. They also lend themselves to modding, if you're the type that likes to mod sets.

The minifigs, however, are sweet. The diver included with this set has an eyepatch and a beard, making him especially useful - plus, the Atlantis diving suits are really quite cool.

The shark minifig, in my opinion, is a little less interesting. Although cool in theory, I didn't find myself admiring it that much. The head piece is nice, although its use may be limited - the body prints have much more MOC potential. Overall, a good inclusion.


As I stated in the opening, it's hard to go wrong with this set. For ten bucks you're getting two sweet minifigs and a solid underwater craft that's pretty fun to play with. Definitely a safe purchase, especially if you're into Atlantis. I give this set high marks.

author: HQuiff
title: Very Average
review:
Introduction

Ah, it's been some time since I last wrote a review, and I think I'll start back with a fairly bog-standard Atlantis underwater floatie, as I shall call it throughout this interview. Well, guess it's approaching a year since I bought it, but sadly I cannot say I still have it built. To cut to the chase I had it dismantled in a month, not that the pieces have done me a lot of good since. Sorry if I sound critical, but to be honest this set has about as many flaws as it does pros. So rather then just lamely name they out as they come to find, let me list them in an organized manner.

Build

I cannot fairly say that the build was easy, because at the time I built it in a car, and by the time I had finished I felt on the brink of throwing up. So just a tip, don't build while moving. Anyway, not so much I can say on the general build, it was despite the travel sickness easy and quite unchallenging. To be fair though, I was very happy with the shark, which I must say is quite a nifty figure, but I'll get onto that later. There was only one bag if my memory serves me correctly, and a smaller sealed bag which held the Sharks head piece.


Pieces

Ah, now this is more of a highlight, as I found myself presently surprised at various newer elements, including a 3x1 flat piece, which I was more then glad to see, despite it's read colour. The shark's head, as I aforementioned, was very pleasing as was the diver. The ring piece was a little under expectations, but nevertheless a plus for me. Then there was the two hooks which are used as the missiles. 

Minifigures

Once again, this was definitely more of an up for me. The shark most especially, with a good overall stature and nice printing design. His legs are somewhat odd, trying to resemble scales of some sort but failing, making it look more like a hobos trousers. The diver was very nice indeed, with a new divers outfit and (Lovely) lime green visor. So definitely a thumbs up from me on this section!

End

So that's all the categories which this sets needs, the price was fair, maybe a few euro overpriced. Overall I'm happy with my buy, but at the same time a little disappointed, especially at the playability factor, which probably doesn't do it for me considering I've never particularly done well with underwater floaties.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: My first Atlantis set...
review:
The Wreck Raider set (8057) is a LEGO Atlantis set which came out in 2010. It comes with 2 minifigures and 64 pieces. This set does include decals.

Box/Instructions

Recommended ages for this set is 6-12. The design of the box is very awsome and really attractive. There're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces in this set

Parts

That set comes with a new head piece for the shark, a new trident and a new treasure key. The helmet and the visor part of the diver are also new.

Minifigures

  • Shark Warrior:The shark warrior has a new trident piece and a new head piece which are hard rubber. He also comes with printed legs and would make a good alien for Star Wars brickfilms or MOC's.
  • Diver:The diver looks very cool. His legs are printed and his torso and face are double-printed. He comes with lime green arms and fins. The diver also has an eye patch so he looks like a pirate...

The build

The build was pretty interesting. I like the whole design of that model and the way how LEGO did the front. It's a very easy build and a good starter set for young kinds.

The completed model

[img]http://http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8057.jpg[/img]

When the model is complete it looks like the one you've seen on the pictures. You get two flick-missles on each side which are harpoons. This set doesn't have so many features as other sets but it's very awsome.

Positive

  • Minifigures
  • Interesting build
  • New elements
  • Pieces for brickfilms and MOC's
  • Design on the box

Negative

  • Stickers

Summary

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on LEGO Shop@Home, Toys-R-US, eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

If you want to see how this model is built you should check out my galery on my website I made. Here is the link where you can check out this galery: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set

Stopmotion: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER#p/u/12/Sf5S7bzMwzw

author: Legonat
title: One of the best atlantis sets.
review:
This is a good starter set for atlantis collectors.

            Pros

  •             Cool minifigs (Ace Speedman, and Shark Warrior),
  •             Good pieces (portal key, grappling hook, turbines, and gray tube),
  •             Missile launchers can move up and down to aim

            Cons
 

  •             Stickers,
  •             Does not include Ace's hair,
  •             Trident gets nicks and scrapes in it when held by minifigs

            Overall a 5/5

author: kenhew
title: Very good underrated set
review:
I personally think this is a very underrated set. If you take into account the parts, as well as the design, it is a very good value set that you can incorporate into your mocs. If you don't fancy the colour red, replace it with another colour scheme and you can get a very good decent addon to other themes like space police 3, for example.

On top of that, the minifigures are absolutely top-notch, the sharkman especially, as well the futuristic diver or whatever you call him. One unexpected surprise is definitely the 1x3 smooth tile...which I know some MoCcers have been yearning for.

The build is fairly easy and hassle-less, but the best of all, is that it also provides a very good playability value for the younger kids as it's very swooshable, with enough content to create a scenario of the diver chasing the menacing looking sharkman (or vice-versa), this is a very good starter kid for them.

Pros

  • Minifigs - sharkman which is awesome
  • Parts
  • Playability

Cons

  • Come to think of it, I really couldn't say any cons about this other than being it may be a bit pricy for such a small set. I got this on discount, so to me it didn't appear to be

Maybe a bit overpriced for some, but try to get it at discount and you'll be surprisingly pleased with it, if not I still think you should still give it a chance.

author: AETerry
title: Wreck Raider Review
review:
For it's value at $9.99, this is a modest sized set and one of the cheaper sets to get a Shark Warrior Minifigure from.

 

The Sub itself is a very good, solid build and is well worth the effort to pick up, regardless of factors from price, to desired minifigure, Atlantis Collection completion. A blue key ring is also included in this set.

author: Odeinoichus
title: We're going to need a bigger sub.
review:
Set #8057 Wreck Raider: This set was a must have in my opinion for two reasons, the first, shark-man Mini-Figure. The second, it's cheap and LEGO Atlantis.

 

Wreck Raider is a miniature submarine piloted by one of the Mini-Figures of the Atlantis Expedition, it doesn't take too long to build, it features minimal sticker application and it gives everyone a chance to own the new shark-man Mini-Figure. All of the new Atlantis based aquatic mini-figures are must haves in my book.

 

The sub features flick fire missiles with little anchors on them, great for firing on the shark-man and knocking him out so you can claim the Atlantis Key. The shark-man comes with a golden trident weapon, the handle of which seems to be based on a softer plastic than past accessories. I suspect this is so it won't crack or become brittle since there is the whole GPS to consider. (Not Global Positioning System, but Gold Plastic Syndrome.)

 

Overall this set fits in quite nicely with any Aqua theme series, it makes a nice cheap addition to any LEGO Atlantis collection and as an added bonus it gives you the opportunity to have two distinct Mini-Figures, an Atlantis Diver and the Shark-Man. The only thing off about the set I can think of is, that one of the pictures in the instructions cross promoting all the sets would seem to indicate that this one includes a harpoon gun, when in fact it does not. Still I highly recommend it for all Aqua Theme lovers. (I wonder if the Aquasharks of Aquazone mutated into these Shark-Men dudes due to the power of Atlantis?)

author: somebody
title: Overall, a very good little set
review:

good build
flick missiles are different, making them cool
Very well built, they must have worked hard on features
lots of different parts, there are not 3 pieces that are the same.
cool stickers

looks to me like it is a sports sub
adjustable propellers, they can move 360 degrees

Cons:
It comes with the blue, squid treasure key, but it comes with a shark warrior, I would prefer a squid warrior,

author: jedi_master_kit_fisto
title: mint
review: it comes with 2 figures, a diver and a shark warrior.the diver is trying to rescue the squid key.the speeder type of thing is cool and can flick fire harpoon guns.for £8 it is a set to add to your Atlantis collection.

author: Mrconnor2000
title: Another great edition!
review:
Hi, our names are Connor, Harry and Harry and we are Professional Lego Reviewers. We have been reviewing for four years and we have reviewed lots of different kinds of Lego sets. We are better at written Lego reviews but if you want to see spoken reviews and more Check out Mrconnor2000 On youtube for Great Lego videos and please rate this review a 5/5.

Box/Instructions

The box on this set showed a Main image on the front and on the back it had alternate images of playability features of the set. The instructions were easy to follow as it has been classed as a easy build set and the instructions also included other Atlantis sets at the back.

Parts

Though there are 64 pieces in this set, it only took about 10 minutes to build and it was a easy progress (as i said before.) There were no missing parts.

Minifigures

There are two minifigures in this set - the Atlantis diver and the Shark-Man

Atlantis Diver - The Atlantis diver has a real name which is 'Ace Speeder'. He has the Green Atlantis Helmet which flippers can stick to when you're not using them but a downside to the helmet is that the vidor does not lift up (Like the Iron Man helmet) which would've been cool but i guess the Iron Man setd came after Atlantis so you can't blame anyone really. His Face includes bushy eye-brows, and rubble around his chin. He has an eye-Patch around one eye which clames he has been in alot of wars and he has a straight kind of 'i can't be bothered to do this mouth' and he has the standard Atlantis uniform including a belt with tools and logos.

The Sharkman - The Sharkman has a molded head and grey skin all over. He has a detailed fin, Very sharp looking teeth and blue eyes. I think he's a great Minifigure.

The build

The build was easy and exciting and only took us about 10 minutes to build.

The completed model

The completed model included two minifigures (which we've already talked about) and the Wreck raider machine. The machine is red and has 7 stickers! Thats right seven! i was quite shocked when i saw that this little set had seven stickers but that was in 2010. it was at the end of 2011 when they started stopping stickers. The machine has two propellor engines and an adjustable handlebar. It also has two flick missles and the blue stone that the bad guys want but the good guys need! Altogether a great set!

Summary

We reccomend you to get this set because its great for anybody and everybody! it isnt in shops now but you can definittely get this on E-bay, Amazon or Trade-me for sure!

Thankyou for reading and please rate this 5/5!

author: Sobel
title: If there was an underwater chopper bike, this would be it.
review:
With all the Corona stuff going on, I find myself with some time on my hands to re-build and review some of my older sets. Now, with this series being some 9-10 years old, it is not really THAT old, at least in my eyes.
This small set once again shows how design can sometimes win over functions and payability, at least for me.

Parts

As always with this series, many red parts, slopes mainly, making the sub stream-lined. This is the smallest set (by pieces) to feature one of the circular "keys" of Atlantis, the blue one with an octopus motive. The set has some above-standard parts, like a large engine/turbine-part and harpoon-like torpedoes. Eight stickers have to be applied, which I think is a little too much, but still OK.

Minifigures

Two minifigures are included in this set: A diver with greenish gear and a shark warrior who wields a trident.The diver has no additional accessory besides his flippers.

The build

Easy, from the bottom up. The large propeller-parts are attached during the process in an easy, yet convincing way. Should be no problem building this sub in some ten minutes or less.

The completed model

The finished sub is very bulky with a massive front and a tapering rear end. It has two harpoon-torpedoes for defence, steering fins to both sides and two large propeller units for maximum velocity. The diver can hold onto the handle as depicted on this site, but he can also be placed in a seated position when his flippers are removed.

Overall opinion

Oh Yeah, it's the Harley-Davidson of underwater exploration, baby!
This small, yet impressive, sub is one of the coolest of the whole series. Even though it has little to no functions (the flip-torpedoes aren't really that much of a deal...), it won me just by its look. So massive, so powerful! Reminded me immediately of a heavy Chopper cruising down the freeway. The two big propeller-parts might seem a little OP, but considering the role as a fast attacker they are absolutely justifiable.
That poor lonely shark warrior seems a little lost against this Junior Whopper of a sub!
